docs.snippet: There was an attack made upon a train of cars yesterday afternoon near Vienna. For incomprehensible reasons the correspondents were not per  mitted to allude to the matter. The faces, I believe, we are now permitted to state.

headline.main: IMPORTANT INTELLIGENCE.; Reported Battle at Booneville, Missouri. Brilliant Success of the Federal Troops. Rebel Loss Three Hundred Killed and Six Hundred Taken Prisoners. headline.main: LATEST NEWS OF THE REBELLION.; MORE TROOPS FROM THE WEST. JOSEPH L. WILLIAMS, of Tennessee, COL. SMALL'S REGIMENT. AN ENGLISH MAN-OF-WAR AT OLD POINT. ADVANCE ON FAIRFAX. A VARIETY OF RUMORS. BALLOON TELEGRAPHING. THE HIGHLAND GUARD BANQUET.

docs.lead_paragraph: The rebel soldiers at Manassas Junction complain bitterly of being compelled to dig and delve in the ditches, during the excessive heat, while the negroes who have been pressed into the service are lazy and worthless for the purposes to which they have been for a time assigned.

headline.main: NAVAL AND MILITARY MOVEMENTS.; ARREST OF A SECESSION LIEUTENANT IN THE NAVY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States frigate St. Lawrence will be reported ready for sea on Monday. She is now at the Philadelphia Navy-yard, where she has been lying since her return from the Brazil squadron, of which she was flag-ship, under Commodore FRENCH FORREST, now commanding "the naval forces of Virginia." She is 1,726 tons burden, and was built at Norfolk.

docs.snippet: At a meeting of the Board of Aldermen held last evening, Alderman VAN BEUNT, of the Eighth Ward, offered a resolution to pay all the bills necessarily incurred by the officers of the Thirteenth, Fourteenth and Twenty-eighth Regiments, previous to...
docs.lead_paragraph: At a meeting of the Board of Aldermen held last evening, Alderman VAN BEUNT, of the Eighth Ward, offered a resolution to pay all the bills necessarily incurred by the officers of the Thirteenth, Fourteenth and Twenty-eighth Regiments, previous to their departure for the seat of war. The resolution was referred to a Special Committee of five, to investigate and report.

headline.main: CONCENTRATION OF FEDERAL TROOPS AT PHILLIPPA.

docs.lead_paragraph: A special dispatch from Grafton, dated yesterday, says that there is a gradual concentration of forces in the direction of Phillippa. The Fourteenth Ohio Regiment had returned there from Buchanan. There is a report of fighting at Buchanan with considerable loss to the rebels, but it is not authentic.

headline.main: LOCAL MILITARY MOVEMENTS.; THIRTY-EIGHTH REGIMENT COL. J.H.H. WARD.
